snippet: The drug company reported a 25 percent increase in its second-quarter net income, dodging the expected drop in shares caused by generic competition.
abstract: Pfizer reports a 25 percent increase in its second-quarter net income as a result of aggressive cost-cutting; posts adjusted net income of $4.67 billion, or 62 cents a share; revenue totaled $15.06 billion, down 9 percent but above expectations of $14.93 billion.
lead_paragraph: The drug company reported a 25 percent increase in its second-quarter net income, dodging the expected drop in shares caused by generic competition.

headline.main: Cost-Cutting Helps Pfizer Beat Analysts’ Expectations
headline.print_headline: Cost-Cutting Helps Pfizer Beat Analysts’ Expectations
